description: Event streaming in high-performance computing (HPC) involves the continuous flow of data generated by various sources that need to be processed in real-time. This problem is critical for applications that require immediate insights from large volumes of data, such as scientific simulations and real-time analytics.
you_have_this_if: You are dealing with large volumes of data generated continuously.
Your application requires real-time processing and low latency.
You need to integrate multiple data sources efficiently.
You are facing challenges with data transfer rates in your HPC environment.
You require a scalable solution that can handle varying data loads.

approaches.best_for: when you need to manage large data streams in HPC applications with high throughput and low latency.
approaches.key_tradeoff: While Mofka provides high performance, it may require more complex setup and tuning.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to efficiently manage and process large data streams in real-time within an HPC environment.
